JUDGES: Javier Borrego Borrego;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Snejana Botoucharova
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He was represented before the ORG by his mother , PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE , LOC ( okresní soud ) ordered the applicant ’s father to pay DATE alimony of CZK CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) to his mother .

On DATE the applicant ’s mother , acting on behalf of her son , requested the court to increase the DATE alimony to be paid for her son ’s needs . In DATE the applicant ’s father stopped paying the alimony . On DATE the applicant ’s mother renewed her request to increase the DATE alimony .
On DATE the applicant reached the age of majority and could , therefore , act before the court in person .

On DATE ORG obliged the applicant ’s father to pay , within DATE of the coming into force of the judgment , the outstanding alimony in the amount of CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) which covered the period from DATE to DATE , finding that this was necessary to ensure the upbringing of the applicant . On DATE it rectified the amount of the outstanding alimony to CZK MONEY ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) .

On DATE the PERSON Regional Court ( krajský soud ) , upon the applicant ’s appeal of DATE , amended the ORG judgment ordering the applicant ’s father to pay , within DATE of the coming into force of the judgment , CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) , being the outstanding alimony for the period from DATE to CARDINAL DATE .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the allegedly excessive length of judicial proceedings are set out in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
